title: Seven Years in The Making: Les Lankhorst’s New CD Kickstarter Campaign Announced
text:
FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE
Salina, Kansas - United States – October 09, 2015 – Today, Les Lankhorst – an award winning musical artist -- announced the launch of a Kickstarter campaign for his new music CD featuring new takes on classics from yesterday and today. Les Lankhorst is seeking your help to raise $13,000 by October 24th to cover recording fees, musician and engineer fees, mastering fees, duplication and design costs, printing costs, and other related costs of production.
"I am so excited to create my first new album in 7 years. I am planning on recording unexpected renditions of songs made famous by artists such as The Beatles, Nat King Cole, and Frank Sinatra and many more. I plan on recording in Kansas with world-class local and international musicians. I am very excited to bring my unique vocal interpretations back to the public in this long anticipated release. I really think listeners will agree that this new album will be perfect to listen to in the car, while relaxing at home after a long day, or even at bedtime for the kids,” stated Lankhorst.
Les plans to have the album ready by Christmas of 2015 and plans on recording in Wichita and his hometown of Salina Kansas.
When you help fund this project you will receive one of the following. What you receive depends on how much you help.
• Great big Virtual Hug
• Digital download of the CD
• Signed Physical copy of the CD
• Signed 8x10
• A personal thank you from Les
• A “Special Thanks” mention in the CD booklet
• A “Associate Producer” or “Producer” credit in the CD booklet
• A personalized video from Les from the recording session
• Personal Skype “thank you!” call
• Special Platinum VIP Package including FREE Live Show Tickets and Performance Coaching Sessions
More About Les Lankhorst
Les started out in theatre at Salina South High School and is a graduate of Kansas State University where he continued honing his stage skills as a member of The K-State Singers. He began his professional theatre career in Kansas City, MO. with roles in Phantom, Diamond Studs and Biloxi Blues in the Inaugural season at The New Theatre and They’re Playing Our Song and the role of Chuck in The Cardigans at The Plaza Dinner Playhouse. After his start in Kansas City he moved to New York City and along with several Workshops and smaller productions, was featured as the Pharaoh in the short-lived Off-Broadway musical Moses, My Love . For two years Les was involved in the hit musical Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat , starring as The Pharaoh at the Fireside Theatre in Wisconsin as well as with the national touring company of Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat . Les has appeared in various film and television projects throughout the years including Law & Order, The Rear Window (starring the late Christopher Reeves) and In & Out (starring Kevin Kline). But his favorite on camera experience was working alongside Robert Redford and James Gandolfini as Redford’s bodyguard in the Dreamworks film, The Last Castle .
